rComments: She definitely makes this class worth going to. The topics are interesting and she is always willing to help her students.  Definitely do the reading, unless you want to fail. The books are great, BUT Adios Happy Homeland will make you want to run into a wall at full speed. There are 7 books in total, including the reader.

Professor Gruesz is amazing, not only because she speaks more than one language or went to Princeton, but because she really cares about what she teaches. I took her ChicanoMexicano lit class and was truly inspired about how much she loved the subject. She is SO SMART, being in her presence is a privilege. Always willing to help too!

Professor Gruesz went above and beyond to make sure to accommodate for everyone, and make sure that everyone was on the same page. She regularly emails and holds office hours. She's harsh on grading, but only because attendance is such a high percentage of the grade. If you don't do well in her class, it's in no way her fault; I can guarantee that.
Boring and uninspiring yet mandatory lectures.

Professor Gruesz brings a passion for her subject and a high standard of excellence to her lectures and her sections. She was very generous with her time in office hours and I always felt that she had my best interests in mind. She assisted me in formulating my ideas for my paper and she inspired me to do my best work.

Compared to the caliber typical of literature professors at UCSC, Prof. Gruesz simply does not fit in.  Her class is comparable to a mediocre high school English class in which the teacher fails to inspire any passion in the students.  Her lectures are dry and feel like they last forever.  Her grading system is both arbitrary and unfair. Avoid.

Class is very easy if you have the slightest bit of motivation. She offers a fair grading system and teaches the content well. If you're interested in the material, you'll have a good time. Very text heavy and deals a lot with the problems encountered by Latino culture, so if that's not your thing, stay away.

This class was really fun.  It was really fast paced and it was often hard to keep up with the reading.I found the lectures interesting. Professor Gruesz is a very good teacher and was very enthusiastic about the subject. Overall, Latino Expressions was a great class and has made me consider changing my lit concentration.Overall, I loved the class.

The class was pretty much 100% discussion of biography and various interpretations of poems. This means that, to be honest, the class didn't so much TEACH something as it sparked intelligent dialog in a structured environment. This may not be your thing, and if it isn't you'll get bored quickly.

US Canon was a very fun class for me. I seemed to be one of the only students willing to speak up when the Professor asked a question. Because everyone else was so quiet it was hard to engage in a discussion in the classroom, but section had plenty of discussion for everyone. The books were well chosen and her lectures were very interesting. Great.

I thought her class was hard at first but then realized that Professor Gruesz is actually really easy-going and helpful. Her lectures tend to be long and she can talk for an hour straight, but if you read (and you don't need to read everything, focus on the books that interest you) and contribute your opinions in class you'll enjoy it much more.

US CANON: makes American lit less daunting and sour. a little disorganized at times, and seems to want more classroom discussion, which in this case has its place in a seminar class, not a lecture. almost too much subject matter to cover in such a 10 week course, but not really her fault. overall worth it, its not hard, just pay attention

She clearly has a lot of passion for the subject, but sadly lacks the ability to transfer that passion to her students.  Long, seemingly extemporaneous lectures which rely heavily on the computer projector and which include NO breaks (keep in mind, the class lasts two hours) make attending this course an epic struggle with conciousness.

Prof. Greusz was an amazing professor when with a small number of students, but in a big lecture, it seemed difficult for her to create a discussion with the class simply because she could not get the class interested.  She knows the material and is very passionate about poetry, but she did not make many poetry converts this quarter.
her lectures are boring and long

This class was small (30 people or less) and Prof. Gruesz really shone in it.  She makes very insightful commentary, but also allows for great class discussions.  Also the reading list was incredible.  Everything on it (except Faulkner) was incredible.
she is awesome! she exudes knowledge!
